prompt: If this simulation is conducted in a class of 30 students, and each minute a student shakes hands with a new student, approximately how many minutes will elapse before all 30 students are infected?
description: A popular classroom simulation of transmission of infectious diseases is to start with one infected student, then have the class mingle and shake hands with each other. When an uninfected student shakes hands with an infected student, both students become infected and can now transmit the disease.
feedback: After someone shakes the hand of an infected person, they can now spread the infection as well. So after 1 minute 2 people are infected; after 2 minutes, 4 people are infected; after 3 minutes, 8 people; 4 minutes, 16 people. By 5 minutes, 32 people could be infected. The amount doubles every minute.
